snippet: Federal prosecutors closed an investigation of the seven-time winner of the Tour de France nearly two years after they began looking into allegations of illegal doping.
abstract: Federal prosecutors say that they have closed their investigation of cycling champion Lance Armstrong without charging him, nearly two years after they began looking into allegations that he and his teammates committed a variety of possible crimes by doping.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors closed an investigation of the seven-time winner of the Tour de France nearly two years after they began looking into allegations of illegal doping.

headline.seo: Federal Prosecutors Drop Lance Armstrong Investigation
headline.main: Inquiry on Lance Armstrong Ends With No Charges
headline.print_headline: Federal Investigation of Armstrong Is Closed
